Reviews.Content: Good quiet location We had a lovely comfortable and clean room overlooking the gardens but we did notice that some of the other rooms were quite small. It was lovely and warm in the hotel and the reception staff were very helpful and welcoming. The hotel's own directions from the airport were excellent, and the short walk into town (across the River Main) was pleasant. We spent 4 nights here and found plenty to do in Frankfurt and the surrounding area (using the S-Bahn to get around.) Very reasonable for a city hotel in a nice location.
Reviews.Author: Barrons

Reviews.Content: Nice Stay We were only in Frankfurt for 1 night after a long intercontinental flight. When looking online for hotels near the airport or train station, it seemed like the neighborhoods were questionable or the prices were very high. We decided to get a little farther away from the transit areas, so we booked our overnight stay at the Maingau which turned out to be a great find! From the airport we took the S train and then had a short walk to the hotel. Our rooms were small, but clean and the area was quiet with many restaurants within walking distance. You must try the small restaurant on the corner for some great coffee. We took a train the next day and it was just a short taxi ride. It turned out to be an excellent value and a good location.
Reviews.Author: Coastlvr

Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay, very nice neighborhood       Maingau double room
Reviews.Author: Massimo1

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Stayed at the Maingau for 2 nights and had a wonderful stay. Great little hotel in a cool neighborhood. Lot's of bars and places to eat. Friendly helpful staff and you can't beat the rate. The rooms and building are a little old but they keep the property in great shape. Not many tourist attractions in Frankfurt but if you need a place to stay you could do a lot worse.
Reviews.Author: SeetheworldSeattle

Reviews.Content: park and beyond this is a gem of a hotel. It is in a residential neighbor across the street from a park. Parking can be difficult but they are very accommodating. Museums are close by. The Old Town is nearbythere is a great breakfast, where eggs are available as well as all the usual cheeses and meats. The rooms are relatively small but the beds are very comfortable.The staff was very pleasant and helpful and spoke English. There is a lift and there is a dining room for evening meals which is top of the line and very expensive. Breakfast is in the same restaurant.
Reviews.Author: endoman31

Reviews.Content: Great Loacation! Thanks Trip Advisor!Really nice Hotel in a great location.Stayed in a single room which was clean and plenty of space.Rooms were cleaned each day, all staff very friendly.Nice breakfast.Location Fantastic for eating places and PLACES TO DRINK!!!.Opposite a park.My first trip to Frankfurt and really enjoyed the place but would stay either at this Hotel or in the area again as much better than the area around the main Railway station!DAVE ROBERTSSOUTHAMPTONUK
Reviews.Author: bilbaodave

Reviews.Content: A great find This was a great find in Frankfurt. It is 3 blocks from the Pedestrian Bridge to Alstadt. It sits accross the street from a park, among many restaurants, bars, and shops. It is a short walk to the S line to go anywhere. The rooms are small, neat, clean and plain. The breakfast buffet is standard but served in the restaurant next door - on linens with wine glasses for water and juice!. Very nice.It has a lift, location and reasonable - all I ask for in a hotel.
Reviews.Author: happytrvlr

Reviews.Content: Clean, Cheap, and Convenient Hotel Maingu is a simple and clean hotel in the older part of Frankfurt. The location is great for walking to the central part of the city. We had two rooms there at the beginning of September--one for two people and one for three. Both were small, simple and clean. I'm not sure I would want to stay here if I were spending a lot of time in the room, but it was entirely adequate for the one night stopover we had. The included breakfast was great, and the staff helpful. Room prices were quite modest for Europe, making the hotel a bargain find at a time when the dollar is weak.
Reviews.Author: yank

Reviews.Content: A most uncomfortable Night       Maingau room
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN

Reviews.Content: Loved Staying at the Hotel Maingau I chose the Hotel Maingau for it's description as a business hotel at a reasonable price for a quick overnight trip to Frankfurt in July. The hotel was about a 20 minute cab ride from the airport and a 10 minutes cab ride from the main train station but it was conveniently located close to main square of Frankfurt. The hotel is located in a quiet, residental area across the river from city square. The staff at the hotel was very professional and helpful. The room was a standard size and very comfortable. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and it consisted of great buffet of meats, cheeses, jams, spreads, breads, eggs, fruit, juices and coffee or tea. The best part of staying at this hotel are the restaurants within a couple of blocks. One of the specialities of Frankfurt is an apple wine and all of the restaurants near the Hotel Maingau serve this wine along with German specialties. I would recommend staying at this hotel if you want to get away from the area around the train station.
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bug_J

Reviews.Content: Great wee hotel! The twin rooms are a little basic but that is the only (mild) criticism.Now thats out of the way I can concentrate on everything else that was excellent - the friendliness of the staff, the breakfasts, the location etc etc.I booked up on the strength of the Trip Advisor ratings almost two years in advance for the World Cup and the email dialogue between the hotel and I as I amended the booking made me realise that I had a fantastic base in the best part of the city.Highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: Upthewell

Reviews.Content: Great Location I stayed at the Hotel Maingau for one night. The location is in the historic Sachsenhausen area of Frankfurt. It was an easy walk from the Bahnhof to the hotel and then to the sights in the area. The room I had was very small, approximatley 120 to 150 square feet. It was very clean with a TV, shower, sink (outside the bathroom), closet and paper-thin walls. The hotel is not for the out of shape. There are many stairs, and the elevator is almost ineffective. The breaksfast is great.Despite its shortcomings the Hotel Maingau is an excellent value. Not only do you save on rate, but there are no cab fares. I plan on staying here on my next layover in Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Maingau We stayed at the Maingau for one night before leaving on our Viking River cruise down the Rhine. We loved this hotel - fabulous value for the price! We paid 70 euros, and that included a buffet breakfast that included meat, cheese, pastries, etc. Our room was very nice, in a simple scandinavian style, and the bathroom was a reasonable size and clean. The location was great - very close (5 min walk) to the applewine taverns, where we had a great time at dinner, and a very short walk (10 min) to the Dom and Christmas market, as well as the Viking boat we were taking. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Franfurt.
Reviews.Author: aabincalif

Reviews.Content: Affordable and great location We stayed in the Maingau for two nights, and we enjoyed our stay. It was a bargain compared with other Frankfurt hotels. The breakfast was great. The quiet location is close to the river and to the Sachenhausen restaurants and nightlife. The only cons were a very small bathroom, no english TV stations, and they didn't give us a wakeup call early one morning.
Reviews.Author: Ravenduffer

Reviews.Content: Definately Recommended Just about to embark on my second visit to Frankfurt and will be staying in the Hotel Maingau again. The location is excellent, about 10 mins walk from the shopping district, 20 mins walk from the Banking/Business district and 10 mins walk from the entertainment district (Sachsenhausen). The staff are very friendly and efficient and the rooms are clean. The rooms may be a bit small/basic for some people, but as I only use them to sleep in, they are fine.Excellent quality for the price/location. Definately recommended.
Reviews.Author: Warstiner

Reviews.Content: The only place we stay in Frankfurt My husband is German and we travel to Germany usually at least once a year flying into Frankfurt. For eight years now, we've been staying at the Maingau as we come into and go out of the city and have always been pleased. It's a nice German-run hotel with a German flavor as opposed to all those chain hotels at the airport. And it's less expensive too. The restaurant is top for the inclusive breakfast or for dinner (which is extra). But there's a multitude of eateries within walking distance for authentic German cuisine. We recommend the Gemalte Haus. Distance to the airport is very do-able. We take a taxi to and from. If you go, reserve in advance and be sure to ask for a non-smoking room or you will most likely get a room that smells like smoke, which can be unpleasant. Also, ask for a balcony. Bathrooms are generally small, but efficient. Parking is practically non-existent, but if you do have a car, let them know and they will usually arrange parking for you. However, you won't need a car once you are there. The longtime frontdesk manager at the hotel has recently retired (2003) and we have not been back since so not sure if everything is still run as efficiently as we have known it, but give it a try.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful for the Price! The hotel staff here were all enormously friendly. In this small German hotel, they usually remembered my name and even my room number. My room was quite tiny, but very clean and very adequate for a trip when I really was only in the room at night to sleep. The shower and bathroom were small, and the sink was actually in the room, not in the tiny bathroom -- but the bed was comfortable, the water was warm, and the price was incredibly small. Breakfast each morning was delicious with a great variety of foods, and the restaurant in the hotel is outstanding. The hotel is in a pleasant residential neighborhood, and yet just a short walk across the bridge to the cathedral and the most scenic part of Frankfurt. There are delightful neighborhood restaurants within walking distance with wonderful food and great atmosphere. The other guests were mostly European, and I had the impression that some stayed there regularly. This is every bit as much a wonderful bargain as indicated in the Fodor Guide, and a great find for Fodor!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
